l21

Read full topic

item.title: Noclip for owners
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

[quote=“OGolemX, post:21, topic:481387”]if (command.startsWith(“noclip”) && playerRights <=2) {
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = (playerName
+ " tried to noclip and has been Kicked Offline");
disconnected = true;
}

you need to have that code no matter what. because look into the code… it disconnects the player who types the command if their player rights are 2 or under. so then only owners can do the command.
the reason you need the disconnecting code in there is because its a client code, so even if the player types it and his player rights isnt 3, he will noclip because there is no statement in the client to block certain player rights.
it may be confusing, as i am not the best at explaining stuff, but just paste that command into your source and you can noclip[/quote]
No need for this command at all. He can just use the client sided ‘playerRights’ integer. The variable is usually ‘myPrivilges’ in most refactored clients.

ruud123:

so i cannot add a code in the client with playerrights?

Look at this line:

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @ruud123 ruud123

so i cannot add a code in the client with playerrights?

item.title: Noclip for owners
item.dc:creator: @OGolemX OGolemX
item.description:
@OGolemX wrote:

if (command.startsWith(“noclip”) && playerRights <=2) {
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = (playerName
+ " tried to noclip and has been Kicked Offline");
disconnected = true;
}

you need to have that code no matter what. because look into the code… it disconnects the player who types the command if their player rights are 2 or under. so then only owners can do the command.
the reason you need the disconnecting code in there is because its a client code, so even if the player types it and his player rights isnt 3, he will noclip because there is no statement in the client to block certain player rights.
it may be confusing, as i am not the best at explaining stuff, but just paste that command into your source and you can noclip

Read full topic

item.title: Noclip for owners
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

OGolemX:

dude i know what it is… im explaining it easy for him to understand…

That was a very bad way to explain it then.

Flame_ was spot on. Think of it like this:
In reality, you can’t walk through walls, fences, doors (literal door), etc. Correct? I’d assume so.
With ::noclip, you can.

Read full topic

item.title: Noclip for owners
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

OGolemX:

noclip is a allstar glitch that allows you to walk through walls

No it isn’t…
No-clipping is taking any solid object that was blocking your path and allowing yourself to walk through it without being “clipped.”
The idea of it being a glitch is because allstar sources are extremely easy to exploit glitches/bugs on, and no-clipping was one of the most exploited.

Read full topic

item.title: Noclip for owners
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“OGolemX, post:7, topic:481387”]the client command should work. now just go into your client.java
and make a command something like this

if (command.startsWith("noclip") && playerRights <=2) {
            PlayerHandler.messageToAll = (playerName
                    + " tried to noclip and has been Kicked Offline");
	disconnected = true;
   }

what the server command will do, is if somebody with player rights 2 or under, does the command, they wil get kicked offline
NOTE* THE COMMAND MAY NOT NEED THE “}” AT THE END. IF YOU GET ERRORS TRY TAKING IT OFF[/quote]

if(command.startsWith("noclip"){
     if(playerRights < 3){
            PlayerHandler.messageToAll = (playerName + " tried to noclip and has been Kicked Offline");
        disconnected = true;
}else{
sM("You are now noclipping.");
}
}

Bad conventions cause wrote in reply box.

Read full topic

item.title: Noclip for owners
item.dc:creator: @OGolemX OGolemX
item.description:
@OGolemX wrote:

the client command should work. now just go into your client.java
and make a command something like this

if (command.startsWith("noclip") && playerRights <=2) {
            PlayerHandler.messageToAll = (playerName
                    + " tried to noclip and has been Kicked Offline");
	disconnected = true;
   }

what the server command will do, is if somebody with player rights 2 or under, does the command, they wil get kicked offline
NOTE* THE COMMAND MAY NOT NEED THE “}” AT THE END. IF YOU GET ERRORS TRY TAKING IT OFF

Read full topic
